content: Iddo Tzameret - Professor @ Imperial College London Home Papers Talks Group CV Iddo Tzameret* Professor Chair in Computational Complexity Department of Computing Imperial College London E-mail: Iddo.Tzameret@gmail.com (For internal College matters only: itzamere@ic.ac.uk ) PhD, Master's: I welcome PhD and Master's student applications to my group. If you're interested please email me. See ad here . Postdoc opportunities: please email me. Internships: see here. • During 2026 we're running a semester-long program in University of Cambridge: Logical foundations of complexity theory • I spent the spring term of 2023 at Berkeley, visiting the Simons Institute at University of California, Berkeley. My research is supported by a five-year ERC (European Research Council) Consolidator Grant, under the EPRICOT project. And EPSRC (Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council, UKRI) Imperial and Oxford joint grant. My research lies broadly in the theory of computing, algorithms and complexity. I'm exploring the limits of efficient computation and inference, both as a natural and a mathematical phenomenon. This includes computational and proof complexity, satisfiability, algebraic, logical and combinatorial approaches in complexity, and the theory of SAT- and constraint-solving. Find out more about my research in my publication page; see also this survey. Short Bio: Since 2021 I'm a professor in the department of computing at Imperial College London. During Spring 2023 I was a visiting scholar at University of California, Berkeley. Before that I've been a professor at Royal Holloway, University of London, a visiting scholar at Oxford University (Winter/Spring 2019), an assistant professor at Tsinghua University (Beijing) and a research fellow at the academy of sciences (Prague). I completed my PhD from Tel Aviv University, Israel, under the supervision of Ran Raz (Weizmann Institute) and Nachum Dershowitz (Tel Aviv University).
